turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about HMS Comet (1822).
turn.1: What was the main ship of the HMS Comet?
turn.2: HMS Comet (1822)  HMS "Comet", a wood-hulled paddle tug completed in 1822, was the first steam ship built for the Royal Navy.
turn.4: "Comet" was built at the yards in Deptford by Boulton, Watt & Co, which was at the time just outside London, in 1822.
turn.5: What was the function of the comet?
turn.6: She was ordered as a tug, for towing ships out of harbour when the wind was not enough to allow them to move by themselves, specifically "to be employed in towing HM ships in the Thames and Medway".
turn.8: The ship was designed by Oliver Lang, the master shipwright at Woolwich Dockyard.
turn.9: What are some interesting aspects of the comet?
turn.10: She was fitted with a two-mast schooner rig, as well as a twin cylinder side-lever engine, which produced 80 nominal horsepower.
turn.11: Did anyone travel on the comet?
turn.12: Humphry Davy travelled on the Comet to Norway to test his zinc protectors for ships' copper bottoms in the summer of 1824.
